newsitem.title: UK: Wilson Bowden sells retail park to Pillar.
newsitem.headline: Wilson Bowden sells retail park to Pillar.

text.p: British property developer and housebuilder Wilson Bowden Plc said on Wednesday it had sold its Fort retail park in Edinburgh, Scotland, to Pillar Property Investments Plc for 41.8 million stg.
The 128,000 sq ft retail warehouse development is under construction and scheduled for completion later this year.
Wilson Bowden said in a statement that the park would comprise high quality fashion retail warehouse accommodation in 12 units, most of which have already been pre-let.
Pillar, the property investment and development group, said that 17 million stg of the total price was payable on exchange and the balance after practical completion in September.
Following this acquisition, Pillar will own 14 retail parks, equating to around 210 million stg in this class of property.
